revised_title: Spectrum Associated with Carbon and its Relation to Wolf-Rayet Stars
tldr: The author observed a spectrum associated with carbon that appears to coincide with some of the most prominent lines in the Wolf-Rayet star spectrum. The spectrum was produced by passing heavy condensed discharges through vacuum tubes containing hydrogen and graphite or carbon electrodes. The author suggests that the Wolf-Rayet lines in question may possibly be due to the same origin as the spectrum associated with carbon.
